hints_html: Recall that the formula for continuously compounded interest is given by \(\displaystyle A = Pe^{rt}\), where A is the new amount, P is the principal, r is the interest rate, and t is the time.
hints_latex:
Recall that the formula for continuously compounded interest is given by
$\displaystyle A = Pe^{rt}$, where \emph{A} is the new amount, \emph{P}
is the principal, \emph{r} is the interest rate, and \emph{t} is the
time.
hints_raw: Recall that the formula for continuously compounded interest is given by <math> \displaystyle A = Pe^{rt}</math>, where ''A'' is the new amount, ''P'' is the principal, ''r'' is the interest rate, and ''t'' is the time.
question: 1 (h)
sols_html:
For continuously compounded interest, we have the formula \(\displaystyle A = Pe^{rt}\) where A is the amount, P is the principal, r is the rate, and t is the time.

We are given that \(\displaystyle P=10000, A=100000, t=2\). Plugging these in yields

\[\begin{aligned} 100000 &= 10000e^{2r} \\ 10 &= e^{2r} \\ \ln 10 &= 2r \\ r &= {\color{blue} \frac{\ln 10}{2}}\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
For continuously compounded interest, we have the formula
$\displaystyle A = Pe^{rt}$ where \emph{A} is the amount, \emph{P} is
the principal, \emph{r} is the rate, and \emph{t} is the time.

We are given that $\displaystyle P=10000, A=100000, t=2$. Plugging
these in yields

\begin{align*}
100000 &= 10000e^{2r} \\
10 &= e^{2r} \\
\ln 10 &= 2r \\
r &= {\color{blue} \frac{\ln 10}{2}}
\end{align*}
statement_html: You borrow 10 thousand dollars from Nick the Shark, who charges you at a fixed rate r that is compounded continuously. If you pay Nick 100 thousand dollars 2 years later, what was the annual rate of interest that he charged? (A calculator-ready form will suffice.)
statement_latex:
You borrow 10 thousand dollars from Nick the Shark, who charges you at a
fixed rate \emph{r} that is compounded continuously. If you pay Nick 100
thousand dollars 2 years later, what was the annual rate of interest
that he charged? (A calculator-ready form will suffice.)
statement_raw:
You borrow 10 thousand dollars from Nick the Shark, who charges you at a fixed rate ''r''
that is compounded continuously. If you pay Nick 100 thousand dollars 2 years later,
what was the annual rate of interest that he charged? (A calculator-ready form will
suffice.)
